alert.note: Alert for Butte; Harding; Northern Meade Co Plains; Perkins; Ziebach (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 19 at 1:19PM MST until December 23 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...EXTREME COLD AND DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS EXPECTED THROUGH FRIDAY... ...GROUND BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY... .A very cold airmass and fast moving storm system will bring dangerously cold wind chills to northeast Wyoming and western to south central South Dakota. A fast moving storm system will bring a quick shot of snow to much of the area Wednesday and Wednesday evening. Snow amounts will be limited to an inch or two, but northwest winds will increase Wednesday afternoon, resulting in extremely cold wind chills through Thursday and Friday. Strong winds across the western and central South Dakota plains will gust to 50-60 mph. With new snow on top of a powdery snowpack, ground blizzard conditions will be possible. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, ground blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Harding County, Perkins County, Butte County, the Northern Meade County Plains and Ziebach County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Cheyenne River Reservation. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to 5 PM MST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel. Widespread blowing snow could create ground blizzard conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Even if you are outdoors for just a few minutes, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means falling and blowing snow with strong winds may produce dangerous whiteout conditions. Monitor NOAA weather radio, local radio or television, or the Internet for updates on this potentially dangerous storm. Take time to prepare for severe winter conditions before the storm develops.

area.areaDesc: Butte; Harding; Northern Meade Co Plains; Perkins; Ziebach
